title: Mathematical Analysis 2
description: Quiz on Mathematical Analysis of Functions of Several Variables

questions.question: What does mathematical analysis of functions of several variables study?

answers.c: Functions that depend on two or more variables

questions.question: How is a function of two variables denoted?
What does the graph of a function of two variables represent?
What does it mean that a function has a limit at a point?

answers.a: The value of the function is maximal
answers.b: The values of the function approach a single value

questions.question: When is a function continuous at a point?

answers.c: If the value of the function equals the limit at that point

questions.question: What is a partial derivative?

answers.a: The derivative of a function of one variable
answers.b: The derivative with respect to one variable while keeping the others fixed

questions.question: How is the partial derivative with respect to x denoted?
What is the gradient of a function?
What does the gradient indicate at a point?

answers.b: The direction of the greatest increase of the function

questions.question: When is a point stationary?

answers.b: When all partial derivatives are equal to zero

questions.question: What is the purpose of the Hessian matrix?

answers.b: Determining the type of a stationary point

questions.question: What does it mean if the Hessian is positive definite?
What does it mean if the Hessian is negative definite?
What is a saddle point?

answers.c: A point without an extremum value

questions.question: What is a double integral?

answers.a: An integral of a function of one variable
answers.b: An integral with respect to two variables

questions.question: What is the purpose of a double integral?
What does the region of integration represent?

answers.a: The set of points over which integration is performed

questions.question: Which coordinate system is often used for double integrals?
What does a change of variables in an integral enable?
What does it mean that a function is differentiable?

answers.c: It can be locally approximated by a linear function
